employment.title: Front End Developer
description: At Incuna, I primarily built iPad apps using Backbone, Sass, and Grunt, and wrapping them in Cordova. I later streamlined this process by creating a custom Yeoman generator for new projects.
In addition, I built several responsive single page apps using Angular, and added D3 to produce dynamic data visualisations. I also worked on the front end for a number of Django websites.

employment.title: Campaign Web Editor
employment.organisation: University of Oxford Development Office, Oxford, UK
description: I developed, maintained and wrote content for several internal and external websites, all on different platforms. I also took on extra development opportunities where possible, building several WordPress sites with custom themes for special projects.
I also gained some experience in print design while creating various internal communications documents, and shooting video content for the websites.

employment.title: Staff Writer
employment.organisation: The Mainichi Newspapers Co., Tokyo, Japan
description: My primary roles were news gathering, writing and editing in both Japanese and English, translation, and photography. I also worked on a Javascript-driven bilingual comic series, and built a custom article archive for the site using KohanaPHP and MySQL.

freelance.title: Director
description: I set up a small company to work on bespoke freelance projects. Aside from primarily Django development, I also meet and communicate with clients, spec projects, and seek out new business.

freelance.organisation: Politics in Spires, University of Oxford
description: I created a custom WordPress theme, migrated the blog from basic hosting to an Ubuntu server, and carried out ongoing development and maintenance.

The Vincent's Club of the University of Oxford commissioned me to produce a new site to allow them to connect with current and former members. I created a responsive WordPress site based a new premium theme, and customised it further with a secure Members' Area, including a searchable register.
